column4: Hi guys, I've been trying to install ubuntu on my old laptop for awhile now. I'm running on a IBM thinkpad a20m, a really old version. The thing is, I can't get into the bios menu without a password. The startup screen runs, then it flashes to a black screen that says time and date error, and then it flashes to another black screen with just a lock and a cursor in the upper lefthand corner.. It won't even let me into the biso menu. I t
of mine told me to try), but I didn't see the silver coin that it's apparently supposed to look like. Does anyone have any ideas on how to get this working? I'd really appreciate it!
use F11 or F12 and you will then be able to choose the boot media
I suggest you run Lubuntu on it, or something lighter like puppy or xpud
